name: Next.js
description: Next.js is a React-based full‑stack framework for building modern web applications, providing built‑in server‑side rendering, static site generation, routing, and performance optimization.

name: JavaScript
description: JavaScript is the core scripting language of the web, running in both browsers and on servers, and is essential for building interactive and dynamic user experiences.

name: React
description: React is a declarative JavaScript library for building user interfaces, emphasizing component‑based architecture and one‑way data flow to manage complex front‑end applications.

name: Vue.js
description: Vue.js is a progressive JavaScript framework that is easy to adopt and well‑suited for scaling from simple widgets to large single‑page applications.

name: C/C++
description: C/C++ are general‑purpose, high‑performance system programming languages commonly used for operating systems, high‑throughput services, game engines, and performance‑critical components.

name: Qt
description: Qt is a cross‑platform C++ application framework that offers a rich set of UI components and tools for building desktop, embedded, and industrial applications.

name: MFC
description: MFC (Microsoft Foundation Classes) is a C++ class library from Microsoft for creating native Windows desktop applications efficiently.

name: Python
description: Python is a high‑level, interpreted programming language with clean syntax and a large ecosystem, widely used in web development, automation, data analysis, and AI/ML.

name: Go
description: Go is an open‑source language designed at Google, featuring simple syntax, native concurrency primitives, and fast compilation, ideal for cloud‑native and distributed systems.

name: PHP
description: PHP is a server‑side scripting language designed for web development, with a mature ecosystem for building content‑driven sites and business applications.

name: ThinkPHP
description: ThinkPHP is a lightweight PHP framework popular in China, focused on rapid development, simplicity, and practicality for small to medium‑sized systems.

name: Laravel
description: Laravel is a modern, elegant PHP web framework offering expressive syntax, powerful routing, ORM, queues, and task scheduling for complex business applications.

name: Objective-C
description: Objective‑C is an object‑oriented programming language historically used for native iOS and macOS development, still relevant for maintaining legacy and low‑level codebases.

name: Android
description: Android is a leading mobile operating system and development platform, covering both system‑level and application‑level development across phones, tablets, and smart devices.

name: Java
description: Java is a mature, object‑oriented language with strong cross‑platform support, widely adopted in enterprise back‑end systems, financial services, telecom, and big‑data ecosystems.

name: Spring Boot
description: Spring Boot is a convention‑over‑configuration framework built on Spring that streamlines the creation, testing, and deployment of Java microservices and back‑end applications.

name: Spring Cloud
description: Spring Cloud provides a suite of tools for building microservice and distributed systems, including configuration management, service discovery, gateways, circuit breaking, and observability.

name: Redis
description: Redis is a high‑performance in‑memory data store supporting rich data structures, commonly used for caching, distributed locks, leaderboards, and lightweight messaging.

name: MySQL
description: MySQL is one of the most widely used open‑source relational database management systems, known for its stability, performance, and ease of operation.

name: SQL Server
description: Microsoft SQL Server is an enterprise‑grade relational database platform offering strong integration, security, and manageability for mission‑critical workloads.

name: C#
description: C# is a modern object‑oriented language from Microsoft, tightly integrated with the .NET platform, and widely used for enterprise systems, desktop apps, and server‑side development.

name: Visual Basic
description: Visual Basic is an event‑driven language that historically enabled rapid Windows application development and remains present in many existing business systems.

name: Basic
description: Basic is a classic beginner‑friendly programming language with simple syntax that has influenced the design of many modern high‑level languages.

name: FoxPro
description: FoxPro is a legacy database programming language and toolset that powered numerous management information systems and industry‑specific applications.

name: PowerBuilder
description: PowerBuilder is an enterprise‑oriented rapid application development tool, well‑suited for building data‑intensive client/server business applications.

name: Delphi
description: Delphi is a visual development environment and language based on Object Pascal, offering fast compilation and high performance for desktop and industrial applications.
